h1: How Many Calories in a Stick of Butter?
assumptions: Standard US stick (1/2 cup, 113 g), unsalted, regular full-fat butter at room temperature.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, salted vs. unsalted, fat content, and processing; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One stick of butter contains about 810 kcal, mostly from fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Whipped butter (lower density, ~80 g per stick equivalent)

faqs.q: How many calories in a stick of butter?
faqs.a: Approximately 810 kcal for a standard 113 g stick.

faqs.q: Is butter high in saturated fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 58 g saturated fat per stick, mostly from dairy.

faqs.q: Does salted butter have more calories?
faqs.a: No, calories are the same; only sodium increases slightly.
Negligible, around 0.1 g per stick with no fiber.

faqs.q: How does butter compare to margarine?
faqs.a: Similar calories, but margarine often has trans fats and varies by type.
